word_mean: 良心，道德心理：精神道德本能的非专业性术语，大致相当于精神分析法“超我”的概念，但与通常的“consciense”概念不同，超我的行为常为无意识的

sentence.Network_en: The Daily Mail has the headline "The Voice of Conscience"
sentence.Network_cn: 《每日邮报》的头版标题为“良知的声音”。

sentence.Network_en: I'm so glad he had a pang of conscience.
sentence.Network_cn: 我很高兴他会有负疚感。

sentence.Network_en: I would like your advice on a matter of conscience, Father.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想就一件有关良心的事征求您的建议，神父。

3. 良知(Conscience)：在圣灵向个人说话时，得到操练和发展。圣灵让人与自己的良知摔跤，并帮助他建立基础于圣经的是非观念。

and ceased to torture Tom's conscience .停止了对汤姆良心的折磨。

jx.jx_en_mean: given the fact that this is probably wrong; in fairness

lj.lj_ly: how can we in all conscience justify the charging of fees for such a service?.
lj.lj_ls: 我们怎么才能凭良心证明为这种服务收费是合理的？。

jx.jx_en_mean: weighing heavily and guiltily on one's mind
jx.jx_cn_mean: 令人感到内疚；受到良心谴责

lj.lj_ly: an act of providence had prevented him from having a death on his conscience.
lj.lj_ls: 天意阻止了他因良心谴责而自杀。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'inner thoughts or knowledge'): via Old French from Latin conscientia, from conscient- 'being privy to', from the verb conscire, from con- 'with' + scire 'know'

entry.def: Your  conscience is the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is right or wrong. If you have a guilty conscience, you feel guilty about something because you know it was wrong. If you have a clear conscience, you do not feel guilty because you know you have done nothing wrong.

example.ex: I have battled with my conscience over whether I should actually send this letter...
example.tran: 我备受良心的煎熬，不知是否真的应该把这封信寄出去。

example.ex: What if he got a guilty conscience and brought it back?...
example.tran: 要是他觉得内疚，把东西拿回来了怎么办？

entry.def: Conscience is doing what you believe is right even though it might be unpopular, difficult, or dangerous.

example.ex: He refused for reasons of conscience to sign a new law legalising abortion.
example.tran: 他出于信仰，拒绝签署使堕胎合法化的新法。

example.ex: ...the law on freedom of conscience and religious organizations.
example.tran: 有关信仰自由和宗教组织自由的法律

entry.def: Conscience is a feeling of guilt because you know you have done something that is wrong.

example.ex: I'm so glad he had a pang of conscience...
example.tran: 我很高兴他会有负疚感。

example.ex: They have shown a ruthless lack of conscience.
example.tran: 他们没有表现出丝毫内疚，实在是太无情了。

entry.def: If you say that you cannot do something in all conscience ,in good conscience, or in conscience, you mean that you cannot do it because you think it is wrong.

example.ex: She could not, in good conscience, back out on her deal with him.
example.tran: 凭良心她不能背弃与他达成的协议。

entry.def: If you have something on your conscience, you feel guilty because you know you have done something wrong.

example.ex: Now the murderer has two deaths on his conscience.
example.tran: 现在，这个杀人犯背着两条人命，受到了良心的谴责。

means.word_mean: 1. motivation deriving logically from ethical or moral principles that govern a person's thoughts and actions
2. conformity to one's own sense of right conduct;
3. a feeling of shame when you do something immoral;

sentences.sentence: "he has no conscience about his cruelty"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 审慎正直的,认真的,本着良心的
stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+sci知道+entious多……的→知道关心的多→有责任,认真的

stems_affixes.value_cn: [of]意识到的,自觉的;神志清醒的

stems_affixes.word_buile: ne不+scient[adj.有知识的, 有技巧的]→adj.无知的;没有知识的
omni到处+scient知道的→adj.无所示在的
pre预先+sci知道+ent……的→预先知道的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有知识的, 有技巧的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sci知道+ent……的→adj.有知识的, 有技巧的
sci知道+ent+ific表形容词→adj.科学上的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不省人事, 未发觉的, 无意识的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+conscious意识到的→adj.不省人事, 未发觉的, 无意识的
sub下面+conscious意识到的→在意识之下→潜意识的
con全部+sci知道+ence表名词→全部知道→良知,良心
pre预先+sci知道+ence表名词→预先知道
scient[adj.有知识的, 有技巧的]+ist专家或人→n.科学家

sentences.en: I had a guilty conscience about not telling her the truth.
sentences.cn: 我因为没有告诉她事实真相而感到内疚。

sentences.en: After he had committed the crime, his conscience was troubled.
sentences.cn: 他犯罪后, 良心上感到很不安。

jushi.english: After he had committed the crime, his conscience was troubled.
jushi.chinese: 他犯罪后,良心上感到很不安。

jushi.english: I had a guilty conscience about not telling her the truth.
jushi.chinese: 我因为没有告诉她事实真相而感到内疚。
